bug.author: MartinoMensio
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The fullscreen of the plotly charts has some problems when exiting. The plot remains wider than the container and overflows on the right <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: Use the following code import streamlit as st import numpy as np import plotly.graph_objects as go import pandas as pd
print(st.__version__) # '0.56.0'
# generate some data m = np.identity(300)
# generate plotly heatmap fig = go.Figure(data=go.Heatmap(z=m)) # display chart st.plotly_chart(fig)
# just to show the width of the normal view df = pd.DataFrame( np.random.randn(10, 20), columns=('col %d' % i for i in range(20))) st.dataframe(df.style.highlight_max(axis=0)) Then click on the full-screen button and go back: the view is broken. See this gif <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11597393/75470409-87621d80-5988-11ea-9343-6da825c9511b.gif></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The plot should be displayed in the same way as before the full-screen. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The plot overflows on the right, out of the normal size of the streamlit app. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
I never tried it before with plotly. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.56.0 Python version: 3.7.6 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? virtualenv OS version: MacOS Catalina 10.15.3 Browser version: Chrome 80.0.3987.122
The plotly version is 4.5.2 <denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
With other plot types it doesn't happen (e.g. line_chart)

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MartinoMensio>@MartinoMensio</denchmark-link> , thanks for catching this! I will move this to our backlog so we can prioritize it.

FYI - there's a way to deal with this. Fix the height of the plotly figure in plotly, and then set streamlit's use_container_width to True. <denchmark-code>fig.update_layout(height=450) st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True) </denchmark-code>
